author: Five Binaries
title: C# SDK for Blockfrost API
description: C# developers are missing (and asked for) tools to enjoy Blockfrost.io, a service that provides free and public Cardano API to developers.

assessments.note: Cardano offers a basic REST endpoint, which makes means clients have to develop the service stub. A SDK would help developers.
Making the cardano api accessible in an easy way does address the challenge very well. Blockfrost is already well established and an c# SDK will improve the situatio further.

The proposer is offering a very useful feature to developers on Cardano similar to how Infura or Alchemy allow users to interact with the blockchain on Ethereum, without having to run a local node. As a developer who frequently uses C# to build tools, having a C# API makes this much more appealing to myself and the numerous other C# developers, and as such, this proposal effectively addresses the challenge.
The challenge is addressed by bringing into the ecosystem C# devs.

This proposal very clearly identifies a lack in the tooling of a subset of Cardano developers and offers to build a solution that would directly improve the experience of developers on Cardano. This is even more relevant as the developers themselves seem to have asked for the development of the SDK as mentioned in the proposal and comments section. My only small concern is with the relatively small numbers of developers that this solution would be impacting, but given the low investment required I don't see this as a major issue.
C# is a very popular language so lots of devs could benefit from this

The team already operates nodes and exposes endpoints. The documentation is very good https://docs.blockfrost.io/
Hence I completely trust them to implement a SDK.
Blockfrost is already well established in the Cardano ecosystem. Five Binaries is well known for their good connections to the community. The estimations are reasonable.

The proposer clearly stipulates a timeframe and set of deliverables and outlines exactly how the proposed budget will be used. The proposer has been successful in previous campaigns so they have some experience in this regard. As an experienced developer myself, there is nothing here that suggests that what is described here can not be accomplished

The team behind the project already has proven themselves within the Cardano community. The proposers are probably the best qualified to take on development of the SDK as it will be an addition to the service they are already offering the Cardano community. The metrics, budget, roadmap and deliverable are clearly laid out and broken down. I share the belief of the proposers that developers working within the Cardano ecosystem should be fairly compensated for their work
The team has implemented other APIs in their platform so it's very likely they already have a good and fast process for new APIs

Regarding auditibility: Definion of success is stated and quite reasonable KPIs. I think 5 downloads in the first month is a pretty low KPI, but the guys of Five Binaries have more experience than me. It will definitly increase over time.

As mentioned above, the target deliverables, timeframe and budget are all laid out in a very clear way. The proposer identifies some key performance metrics to gauge their success. Also, by making this open-source, they are contributing to the Cardano community
This is feasible and meets a need the prospers say developers have asked for.
There is a general timetable. But it lacks more detailed milestones to follow the progress of the project.

Clear metrics for audibility are provided in the project. The implementation roadmap is described and would be easy to follow by the community. The fact that the SDK that is the scope of this proposal is going to be open source further improves the audibility of this project.
The definition of success is missing, but the fact that there's a free plan on blockfrost means some technical persons could follow the progress
assessments.reply: The proposal includes KPIs, which defines the sucess as well as the short term and long term goals are defined.

solution: We want to build an open-source SDK (Software Development Kit - a set of tools, libraries and documentation) for C# developers.
experience: We are the creators of Blockfrost.io, creating services and tools lowering barriers to entry for developers.
